It is important to remember that Hepatitis starts gradually with progressive: 
✱  Loss of appetite.
✱  nausea 
✱  Vomiting.
✱  Low-grade fever gradually becoming moderate.
✱  Feeling of weakness
✱  Yellowing of the eyes and the urine.
What to do if someone has jaundice?
✱  It is essential to give plenty of oral fluids. 
✱  It is also important to give small amounts of bland, non-spicy food. The patient 
may initially refuse to eat but the caregiver must encourage the person to take 
small quantities at frequent intervals. Sometimes it is necessary to prepare 
special food (which could be sweet) that the person likes, to encourage eating.
